statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Montana St. 70, N. Colorado 67
article.story: GREELEY, COLO. (AP) -- Casey Durham scored 18 points and Branden Johnson added 15 as Montana State defeated Northern Colorado for the ninth straight time, winning 70-67 Thursday night. Durham was 4-for-6 on 3-pointers while Johnson had three treys for Montana State (11-8, 3-3 Big Sky). The Bobcats won with little contribution from Big Sky Conference leading scorer Carlos Taylor, who had only six points. He has averaged 19 points a game. Thanasi Panagiotakopoulos led Northern Colorado (8-11, 2-4) with 14 points. Robert Palacios had 11 points and 12 rebounds for the Bears, who last defeated Montana State in 1956. It was the Bears' third consecutive loss. Montana State outscored the Bears 20-9 to start the second half. Johnson connected on his third 3-pointer of the second half to put the Bobcats ahead 50-38 with 12:14 left. Northern Colorado pulled to within 55-51 with 7:12 remaining after Will Figures' jumper and a rebound basket. Taylor's second basket of the second half with 4:08 to play gave Montana State some breathing room at 64-56. Panagiotakopoulos converted a 3-point play and then a layup with 9.4 seconds left, pulling the Bears to within 68-67. But Johnson sealed the win with two free throws. Panagiotakopoulos missed a 3-point attempt with two seconds left. The game was tied at 27 at halftime when Jabril Banks beat the buzzer with a layup for Northern Colorado. It came 28 seconds after Durham's 3-pointer gave the Bobcats a two-point lead. The Bears led 14-4 early after 3-pointers by Neal Kingman and Mason, but then went nine minutes without scoring. While the Bears struggled, Montana State went on a 15-0 run, getting seven points from Mecklen Davis and taking a 19-14 lead.
